Title: Niushou Mountain Cultural Tourism Area (≈£ ◊…ΩŒƒªØ¬√”Œ«¯)
Description: Opening Hours: 9:00 - 17:00 (last entry at 16:30, closed on Mondays except public holidays). Average Cost: Approximately $20 (adult ticket), $10 (child ticket, 1.2-1.4 meters tall). Attraction Features: It is a well-known Buddhist cultural scenic spot, famous for the Foding Palace which houses the parietal bone relic of Sakyamuni Buddha. The Foding Palace has a magnificent architectural style, combining modern design with traditional Buddhist culture. The underground palace on the 6th floor is the core area to worship the relic, with exquisite decorations and a solemn atmosphere. There are also beautiful natural landscapes around the palace, suitable for sightseeing and cultural experience.
Tips: 1. It is recommended to book tickets online in advance, especially during peak tourist seasons (such as weekends and holidays), to avoid long queues at the ticket office. 2. Wear comfortable shoes as there is a certain amount of walking involved in the scenic area. 3. Photography is not allowed in the underground palace where the Buddha relic is enshrined, so please abide by the relevant regulations.

Title: hongshan Forest Zoo (∫Ï…Ω…≠¡÷∂ØŒÔ‘∞)
Description: Opening Hours: 8:30 - 17:00 (last entry at 16:00, no closure on Mondays). Average Cost: Approximately $9 (adult ticket), free for children under 1.4 meters tall. Attraction Features: It is a large-scale forest zoo in Nanjing, home to more than 300 species of animals, including rare ones like Australian koalas, giant pandas, Siberian tigers, and red pandas. The zoo is divided into different animal exhibition areas according to geographical regions and animal types, such as the Australian Animal Area, African Savanna Area, and Panda House. The environment in the zoo is lush with trees, providing a natural living environment for animals and a pleasant sightseeing experience for visitors.
Tips: 1. The zoo is quite large, so it is advisable to plan the visiting route in advance to avoid missing favorite animal areas. 2. Do not feed the animals with self-prepared food, as it may be harmful to their health. 3. Keep a safe distance from the animals and do not tap or bang on the enclosures.

Title: Confucius Temple - Qinhuai River Scenic Belt (∑Ú◊”√Ì«ÿª¥∑Áπ‚¥¯)
Description: Opening Hours: Confucius Temple area: 8:30 - 22:00; Qinhuai River cruise: 9:00 - 21:30 (winter), 9:00 - 22:00 (summer). Average Cost: Free for visiting Confucius Temple area; approximately $15 - $20 for Qinhuai River cruise (different prices for day and night cruises). Attraction Features: It is a representative cultural scenic spot in Nanjing, combining historical relics, folk culture, and natural scenery. Confucius Temple, the core of the area, is an ancient architectural complex dedicated to Confucius, with a history of hundreds of years. Taking a boat cruise on the Qinhuai River at night allows visitors to enjoy the beautiful night views of the both banks with bright lights and ancient buildings, experiencing the unique "Jinling style" (style of Nanjing in ancient times). There are also many local snack shops and traditional handicraft stores in the area.
Tips: 1. The scenic belt is very crowded during peak tourist seasons and festivals, so be careful with personal belongings. 2. For the Qinhuai River cruise, it is recommended to choose the night cruise to enjoy the most beautiful scenery. 3. Try local snacks such as salted duck, stinky tofu, and sweet osmanthus cake, but choose regular shops to ensure food safety.

Title: Dabao'en Temple Ruins Scenic Area (¥Û±®∂˜À¬“≈÷∑æ∞«¯)
Description: Opening Hours: 9:00 - 17:30 (last entry at 16:30, closed on Mondays except public holidays). Average Cost: Approximately $12 (adult ticket), $6 (child ticket, 1.2-1.4 meters tall). Attraction Features: It is a cultural scenic spot built on the ruins of the ancient Dabao'en Temple, which was once the center of Buddhism in China during the Ming and Qing dynasties. The most famous scenic spot here is the Ruins of the Glazed Pagoda of Dabao'en Temple, which was known as the "No.1 Pagoda in the World" in ancient times. The scenic area also has a museum displaying cultural relics unearthed from the temple ruins, such as glazed components and Buddhist statues, allowing visitors to understand the history and culture of the ancient temple. The light and shadow show in the scenic area is also a highlight, creating a magical and solemn atmosphere.
Tips: 1. The light and shadow show has fixed performance times, so it is recommended to check the schedule in advance and arrange the visiting time accordingly. 2. The scenic area has a large number of cultural relics, so please do not touch or damage the exhibits. 3. There are many steps in the scenic area, so elderly people and children should be accompanied and take care when walking.

Title: Nanjing Museum (ƒœæ©≤©ŒÔ‘∫)
Description: Opening Hours: 9:00 - 17:00 (last entry at 16:00, closed on Mondays except public holidays). Average Cost: Free (but reservation is required). Attraction Features: It is one of the three largest museums in China, with a history of more than 80 years. The museum has a large collection of cultural relics, more than 430,000 pieces, covering various periods from the Neolithic Age to the Republic of China. The exhibits include precious cultural relics such as the Jade Burial Suit Sewn with Gold Thread, the Bricks with Paintings of the Seven Sages of the Bamboo Grove, and the Blue and White Porcelain Vase with the Pattern of "Xiao He Chasing Han Xin Under the Moon". The museum is divided into several exhibition halls, including the History Hall, the Art Hall, and the Republic of China Hall. The Republic of China Hall restores the street scene of old Nanjing in a real-life way, allowing visitors to experience the life style of that period.
Tips: 1. Since the museum is free but requires reservation, please make an appointment on the official website or official WeChat account 3 - 7 days in advance. 2. The number of visitors allowed in the museum is limited every day, so it is better to arrive early to avoid missing the opportunity to visit. 3. Photography is allowed in the museum, but using flash is prohibited to protect the cultural relics.

Title: Nanjing Presidential Palace (ƒœæ©◊‹Õ≥∏Æ)
Description: Opening Hours: 8:30 - 18:00 (last entry at 17:00, closed on Mondays except public holidays). Average Cost: Approximately $10 (adult ticket), $5 (child ticket, 1.2-1.4 meters tall). Attraction Features: It is a famous historical site in China, with a history of more than 600 years. It has witnessed many important historical events in China, from the Liangjiang Governor's Office in the Qing Dynasty to the Presidential Palace of the Republic of China. The architectural complex in the scenic area combines Chinese and Western styles, including the former office building of the President, the Xuyuan Garden (a classical Chinese garden), and the Exhibition Hall of Modern Chinese History. The exhibition halls display a large number of historical photos, documents, and cultural relics, allowing visitors to understand the modern history of China and Nanjing.
Tips: 1. The scenic area has a large number of historical exhibits, so it is recommended to rent an audio guide (approximately $3) or join a guided tour to better understand the historical background. 2. Do not take photos of the exhibits marked "No Photography" to protect the historical materials. 3. The Xuyuan Garden is a beautiful classical garden, so you can take some time to enjoy the scenery and relax.

Title: Jiming Temple (º¶√˘À¬)
Description: Opening Hours: 7:30 - 17:00 (winter), 7:30 - 17:30 (summer). Average Cost: Approximately $5 (adult ticket), free for children under 1.2 meters tall. Attraction Features: It is one of the oldest Buddhist temples in Nanjing, with a history of more than 1,500 years. The temple is located at the foot of Jilong Mountain, with a quiet and solemn environment. The main buildings of the temple include the Mountain Gate, the Hall of Heavenly Kings, the Hall of Great Buddha, and the Hall of Guanyin. Every spring (from late February to early March), the cherry blossoms in front of the temple are in full bloom, forming a beautiful "Cherry Blossom Avenue", which is a famous cherry-viewing spot in Nanjing. The temple also provides vegetarian food, which is loved by many visitors.
Tips: 1. During the cherry blossom season, the temple is extremely crowded, so it is recommended to go early in the morning or on weekdays to avoid the peak. 2. When visiting the temple, please abide by the Buddhist etiquette, do not make loud noises, and do not wear revealing clothes. 3. The vegetarian food in the temple is very popular, but it may be sold out quickly, so you can go to the dining area in advance.

Title: Qixia Mountain (∆‹œº…Ω)
Description: Opening Hours: 7:30 - 17:30 (spring and summer), 7:30 - 17:00 (autumn and winter). Average Cost: Approximately $12 (adult ticket, peak season - autumn), $8 (adult ticket, off-season), $6 (child ticket, 1.2-1.4 meters tall). Attraction Features: It is a famous mountain scenic spot in Nanjing, known as the "First Famous Mountain in Jinling". The mountain is famous for its red leaves. Every autumn (from late October to early December), the maple leaves all over the mountain turn red, forming a beautiful landscape of "red leaves all over the mountain". There are also many historical relics on the mountain, such as the Qixia Temple (one of the four famous Buddhist temples in Jiangnan), the Relic Pagoda of Qixia Temple (a national key cultural relic protection unit), and the Thousand-Buddha Cliff. The Qixia Temple has a long history and a solemn atmosphere, attracting many Buddhist believers and tourists.
Tips: 1. The best time to view red leaves is from late October to early December, so it is recommended to plan the trip according to this time. 2. The mountain road is relatively steep in some sections, so wear non-slip shoes and take care when climbing. 3. There are many temples and cultural relics on the mountain, so please respect the religious beliefs and cultural relics, and do not scribble or damage them.

Title: Nanjing Massacre Memorial Hall (ƒœæ©¥ÛÕ¿…±”ˆƒ—Õ¨∞˚ºÕƒÓπ›)
Description: Opening Hours: 8:30 - 16:30 (last entry at 16:00, closed on Mondays except public holidays). Average Cost: Free (but reservation is required). Attraction Features: It is a memorial site built to commemorate the 300,000 compatriots who were killed in the Nanjing Massacre in 1937. The memorial hall is divided into several parts, including the Exhibition Hall of Historical Facts, the Memorial Square, the Hall of Sorrow, and the Mass Grave Site. The Exhibition Hall of Historical Facts displays a large number of historical photos, documents, cultural relics, and video materials, truly reflecting the tragic history of the Nanjing Massacre. The Memorial Square has a large-scale sculpture group, expressing the grief and memory of the victims. The atmosphere of the entire memorial hall is solemn and solemn, reminding people to cherish peace and remember history.
Tips: 1. The memorial hall is a solemn place, so please dress neatly and appropriately, do not make loud noises, and do not run or play. 2. Reservation is required to visit the memorial hall, so please make an appointment on the official website in advance. 3. Do not take photos or videos in the areas marked "No Photography/Videography" to maintain the solemnity of the memorial hall. 4. Children should be accompanied by adults, and parents should guide their children to understand the history correctly and cherish peace.

Title: Indus Avenue (Œ‡Õ©¥Ûµ¿)
Description: Opening Hours: All day (outdoor scenic spot, no specific closing time). Average Cost: Free. Attraction Features: It is a famous scenic road in Nanjing, mainly referring to the Lingyuan Road section in the Zhongshan Scenic Area. The road is about 3 kilometers long, with tall plane trees (also known as indus trees) planted on both sides. The branches and leaves of the trees interweave to form a natural "green archway", creating a very romantic and beautiful scenery. Every spring and summer, the leaves are lush and green, and the road is shaded by trees; every autumn, the leaves turn yellow, and the road is covered with golden leaves, which is very suitable for taking photos and walking. The road connects Zhongshan Mausoleum and Ming Xiaoling Mausoleum, so you can visit the two scenic spots while enjoying the scenery of the Indus Avenue.
Tips: 1. The best time to visit is from April to May (spring) and September to October (autumn), when the scenery is the most beautiful. 2. There are many cars passing by on the road, so please pay attention to traffic safety when walking or taking photos. 3. Do not pick the leaves or damage the trees to protect the ecological environment of the scenic spot.

Title: Meiling Palace (√¿¡‰π¨)
Description: Opening Hours: 8:30 - 17:00 (last entry at 16:30, closed on Mondays except public holidays). Average Cost: Approximately $8 (adult ticket), $4 (child ticket, 1.2-1.4 meters tall). Attraction Features: It was originally the official residence of the Chairman of the National Government, and was later the residence of Chiang Kai-shek and Soong Mei-ling, so it is called "Meiling Palace". The building is a three-story palace-style building, combining Chinese and Western architectural styles. The exterior of the building is mainly light yellow, with green tiles on the roof, and the overall appearance is elegant and magnificent. The interior of the palace preserves the original layout and furnishings of that year, such as the living room, bedroom, study, and dining room, allowing visitors to understand the life of Chiang Kai-shek and Soong Mei-ling. The most distinctive feature is that when viewed from the air, Meiling Palace and the surrounding plane tree avenue form a shape like a "necklace with a gem", which is very unique.
Tips: 1. To appreciate the "necklace" shape of Meiling Palace, you can climb to the observation platform of Zhongshan Mausoleum or take a drone to take photos (drone flying needs to comply with relevant regulations and obtain permission). 2. The interior of the palace has a large number of precious cultural relics and furnishings, so please do not touch or take photos of the exhibits marked "No Photography". 3. The scenic area is located in the Zhongshan Scenic Area, so it is recommended to visit it together with Zhongshan Mausoleum and Ming Xiaoling Mausoleum to save time.

Title: Dr. Sun Yat-sen's Mausoleum (÷–…Ω¡Í)
Description: Opening Hours: 8:30 - 17:00 (last entry at 16:30, closed on Mondays except public holidays). Average Cost: Free (but reservation is required). Attraction Features: It is the mausoleum of Dr. Sun Yat-sen, the great pioneer of China's democratic revolution. The mausoleum is located on the southern foot of Zijin Mountain, with a magnificent architectural complex. The main buildings are arranged along the central axis, including the Archway of Universal Love, the Mausoleum Road, the Mausoleum Gate, the Stele Pavilion, the Memorial Hall, and the Tomb Chamber. There are 392 steps from the Archway of Universal Love to the Memorial Hall, symbolizing the 392 million Chinese people at that time. The architectural style of the mausoleum combines Chinese traditional architecture and Western modern architecture, with a solemn and magnificent atmosphere. Standing on the platform of the Memorial Hall, you can overlook the beautiful scenery of Nanjing City.
Tips: 1. Reservation is required to visit Zhongshan Mausoleum, so please make an appointment on the official website or official WeChat account in advance. 2. There are a lot of steps, so elderly people and people with mobility difficulties can take the battery car in the scenic area (approximately $3 one way). 3. The mausoleum is a solemn place to commemorate Dr. Sun Yat-sen, so please keep quiet and respect the historical relics.

Title: Ming Xiaoling Mausoleum (√˜–¢¡Í)
Description: Opening Hours: 6:30 - 18:30 (spring and summer), 7:00 - 17:30 (autumn and winter). Average Cost: Approximately $15 (adult ticket), $7.5 (child ticket, 1.2-1.4 meters tall). Attraction Features: It is the mausoleum of Zhu Yuanzhang, the first emperor of the Ming Dynasty, and his wife Empress Ma, and was listed as a World Cultural Heritage in 2003. The mausoleum has a large scale and a unique architectural layout, including the Sacred Way, the Meridian Gate, the Hall of Eminent Favor, the Square City and Ming Tower. The Sacred Way is the most distinctive part of the mausoleum, with 12 pairs of stone animals (such as stone lions, stone elephants, and stone horses) and 6 pairs of stone figures (civil officials and military officers) on both sides. These stone carvings are exquisitely carved and have a history of more than 600 years. Every autumn, the ginkgo trees and maple trees on the Sacred Way turn yellow and red, forming a beautiful "most beautiful 600 meters in Nanjing".
Tips: 1. The best time to visit the Sacred Way is in autumn (late October to early November), when the leaves are colorful. 2. The mausoleum is large, so it is recommended to wear comfortable shoes and plan the visiting route in advance. 3. There are many historical relics and stone carvings in the scenic area, so please do not climb or damage them.

Title: Linggu Temple (¡Èπ»À¬)
Description: Opening Hours: 8:00 - 17:30 (spring and summer), 8:00 - 17:00 (autumn and winter). Average Cost: Approximately $8 (adult ticket), $4 (child ticket, 1.2-1.4 meters tall). Attraction Features: It was originally built in the Southern Dynasties and was moved and renamed "Linggu Temple" in the Ming Dynasty. It is one of the famous Buddhist temples in Jiangnan. The main buildings of the temple include the Archway of Linggu, the Hall of Heavenly Kings, the Hall of Great Buddha, and the Beamless Hall. The Beamless Hall is a masterpiece of brick and stone arch architecture in the Ming Dynasty, with no beams or pillars inside, and has a history of more than 600 years. There is also the Linggu Pagoda in the temple, which is 60.5 meters tall. Climbing to the top of the pagoda, you can overlook the beautiful scenery of the entire Zhongshan Scenic Area. The surrounding environment of the temple is quiet and beautiful, with lush trees and fresh air, making it a good place for leisure and sightseeing.
Tips: 1. The Linggu Pagoda has a lot of steps, so people with fear of heights or poor physical condition should be careful when climbing. 2. The temple is a quiet place, so please keep quiet and do not make loud noises. 3. There are many ancient trees in the temple, so please do not pick the leaves or damage the trees.

Title: Music Platform (“Ù¿÷Ã®)
Description: Opening Hours: 9:00 - 17:00 (last entry at 16:30, closed on Mondays except public holidays). Average Cost: Approximately $5 (adult ticket), $2.5 (child ticket, 1.2-1.4 meters tall). Attraction Features: It is an open-air performance venue built to commemorate Dr. Sun Yat-sen. The music platform is designed in a semicircular shape, with a stage in the center and auditoriums around it. The architectural style is simple and elegant, combining Chinese and Western elements. There are many white doves living in the music platform. Every day, there are fixed feeding times for the doves. Visitors can buy feed (approximately $1) to feed the doves and take photos with them. The music platform also holds various cultural performances from time to time, such as concerts and folk art performances, creating a pleasant and lively atmosphere.
Tips: 1. The dove feeding time is usually at 10:00, 11:00, 14:00, and 15:00 every day. You can arrange the visiting time according to this. 2. When feeding the doves, please be gentle and do not chase or scare them. 3. If you want to watch the performance, please check the performance schedule in advance and arrive at the venue on time.

Title: Purple Mountain Observatory (◊œΩ…ΩÃÏŒƒÃ®)
Description: Opening Hours: 9:00 - 16:30 (last entry at 16:00, closed on Mondays except public holidays). Average Cost: Approximately $8 (adult ticket), $4 (child ticket, 1.2-1.4 meters tall). Attraction Features: It is the first modern astronomical observatory designed and built by China itself, known as the "cradle of modern astronomy in China". The observatory is located on Tianbao Peak, the third peak of Zijin Mountain, with an altitude of 267 meters. There are many ancient and modern astronomical instruments in the observatory, such as the Armillary Sphere, the Celestial Globe, and the Refracting Telescope. The Ancient Astronomical Instrument Exhibition Hall displays a group of ancient astronomical instruments made in the Ming and Qing dynasties, which are exquisitely crafted and have high historical and scientific value. The modern astronomical observation area has advanced telescopes, and visitors can observe celestial bodies under the guidance of professionals (observation activities are usually held at night, and need to be reserved in advance).
Tips: 1. The observatory is located on a mountain, so the road is steep. It is recommended to take the cable car up the mountain (approximately $10 one way) or drive. 2. The night observation activities are affected by the weather. Please check the weather forecast in advance and make an appointment with the observatory. 3. The ancient astronomical instruments are precious cultural relics, so please do not touch or damage them.

Title: Yuejiang Tower (‘ƒΩ≠¬•)
Description: Opening Hours: 9:00 - 17:30 (last entry at 17:00, no closure on Mondays). Average Cost: Approximately $10 (adult ticket), $5 (child ticket, 1.2-1.4 meters tall). Attraction Features: It is one of the four famous buildings in the south of the Yangtze River, together with the Yellow Crane Tower in Wuhan, the Yueyang Tower in Yueyang, and the Tengwang Pavilion in Nanchang. The tower is located on the top of Lion Mountain, with a height of 52 meters. It has 7 floors (4 floors on the outside and 3 hidden floors inside). The architectural style of the tower is magnificent, with yellow glazed tiles on the roof and reddish-brown columns and doors and windows, showing the grandeur of the Ming Dynasty royal architecture. Standing on the top of the tower, you can have a panoramic view of the Yangtze River and the scenery of Nanjing City. The interior of the tower displays many cultural relics and works of art, such as the porcelain painting "Zheng He's Voyages to the West" (the largest porcelain painting in China) and the dragon-shaped caisson carved from camphor wood.
Tips: 1. There are many steps to climb to the top of the tower, so wear comfortable shoes. 2. The best time to enjoy the view from the tower is on a clear day, when you can see the Yangtze River more clearly. 3. The "Zheng He's Voyages to the West" porcelain painting is a precious work of art, so please do not take photos with flash to avoid damaging the painting.

Title: Xuanwu Lake Park (–˛Œ‰∫˛π´‘∞)
Description: Opening Hours: 6:00 - 22:00 (park area), 9:00 - 18:00 (boat rental service). Average Cost: Free for entering the park; approximately $8 - $15 for boat rental (different prices for different types of boats, such as pedal boats and motor boats). Attraction Features: It is the largest urban park in the south of the Yangtze River, with a history of more than 1,500 years. The lake covers an area of about 3.7 square kilometers, and there are five islands in the lake, namely Yingzhou Island, Huanzhou Island, Liangzhou Island, Cuizhou Island, and Lingzhou Island. Each island has its own characteristics: Yingzhou Island is famous for its cherry blossoms, Huanzhou Island is known for its peonies, and Liangzhou Island has a large number of historical relics. Visitors can take a boat to tour the lake and enjoy the beautiful scenery of the lake and mountains, or walk and ride bicycles along the lake shore. The park is also a popular place for local people to do morning exercises, fly kites, and have picnics.
Tips: 1. The boat rental service has a time limit (usually 1 - 2 hours), so please return the boat on time to avoid additional charges. 2. The lake area is large, so pay attention to the weather changes. Do not go boating in bad weather (such as strong wind and rain). 3. There are many scenic spots in the park, so you can rent a bicycle (approximately $3 per hour) to visit, which is more convenient and time-saving.

Title: Zhanyuan Garden (’∞‘∞)
Description: Opening Hours: 8:30 - 17:30 (spring and summer), 8:30 - 17:00 (autumn and winter). Average Cost: Approximately $8 (adult ticket), $4 (child ticket, 1.2-1.4 meters tall). Attraction Features: It is one of the famous classical gardens in the south of the Yangtze River, known as the "First Garden in Jinling". The garden was built in the Ming Dynasty and has a history of more than 600 years. The garden is divided into the eastern and western parts. The eastern part is mainly the former residence of the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom and the exhibition area of historical relics, displaying a large number of cultural relics and historical materials of the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom. The western part is the classical garden area, with rockeries, ponds, pavilions, and corridors. The rockeries in the garden are exquisitely piled up, and the ponds are clear and calm, reflecting the surrounding buildings and trees, creating a beautiful "water and mountain" scenery. The garden also has a large number of ancient trees and famous flowers, making the environment quiet and elegant.
Tips: 1. The garden is relatively small, but there are many winding paths and pavilions. It is recommended to visit slowly and carefully appreciate the details of the garden. 2. The exhibition area of the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom has a lot of historical knowledge, so you can read the introduction carefully or join a guided tour to better understand the history. 3. Do not pick the flowers or damage the plants in the garden to protect the ecological environment of the garden.

Title: Yuhuatai Scenic Area (”Íª®Ã®)
Description: Opening Hours: 8:30 - 17:00 (last entry at 16:30, no closure on Mondays). Average Cost: Free (some exhibition halls may charge a small fee, but the main scenic area is free). Attraction Features: It is a memorial scenic area integrating education, tourism, and leisure, to commemorate the revolutionary martyrs who sacrificed here. The core area of the scenic area is the Martyrs' Cemetery Area, which includes the Group Sculpture of Martyrs' Martyrdom, the Monument to Yuhuatai Martyrs, and the Memorial Hall of Yuhuatai Martyrs. The Group Sculpture of Martyrs' Martyrdom is the largest granite sculpture group in China since the founding of the People's Republic of China, depicting the heroic images of nine martyrs. The Monument to Yuhuatai Martyrs is 42.3 meters tall, symbolizing the liberation of Nanjing on April 23, 1949. In addition to the memorial facilities, the scenic area also has scenic spots such as the Yuhuatai Stone Cultural Area (displaying the formation and culture of Yuhua Stone) and the Ecological Forest Area (with lush trees and fresh air).
Tips: 1. The scenic area is a memorial place for revolutionary martyrs, so please dress neatly and keep quiet, and do not make loud noises or play. 2. The Yuhua Stone Cultural Area has a lot of precious Yuhua Stones. Please do not touch or take the exhibited stones. 3. The scenic area is large, so it is recommended to wear comfortable shoes and bring a bottle of water, especially in summer.

Title: Yihe Road Mansion Area (“√∫Õ¬∑π´π›«¯)
Description: Opening Hours: All day (outdoor scenic area, some mansions are not open to the public). Average Cost: Free (visiting the outdoor area; if some mansions are open to the public, there may be a small charge). Attraction Features: It is a famous historical and cultural block in Nanjing, known as "One Yihe Road, Half of the History of the Republic of China". The block has more than 200 western-style mansions built in the 1920s and 1930s, which were once the residences of senior officials and celebrities of the Republic of China. The architectural styles of the mansions are diverse, including French Renaissance style, British Gothic style, and American Colonial style. The roads in the block are lined with tall plane trees, creating a quiet and elegant atmosphere. Walking in the block, you can feel the strong historical and cultural atmosphere of the Republic of China, and it is also a popular place for taking photos.
Tips: 1. Most of the mansions in the block are private residences or office areas and are not open to the public. Please do not break into private areas. 2. The block is a quiet residential area, so please keep quiet and do not make loud noises or litter. 3. The best time to visit is in the morning or afternoon, when the light is good and suitable for taking photos.

Title: Nanjing City Wall (Taicheng Section) (ƒœæ©≥««Ω£®Ã®≥«∂Œ£©)
Description: Opening Hours: 8:30 - 17:30 (spring and summer), 8:30 - 17:00 (autumn and winter). Average Cost: Approximately $8 (adult ticket), $4 (child ticket, 1.2-1.4 meters tall). Attraction Features: It is a section of the Ming Dynasty City Wall in Nanjing, and it is the only section of the city wall adjacent to the lake (Xuanwu Lake). The city wall was built in the Ming Dynasty, with a history of more than 600 years. The Taicheng Section is about 1.5 kilometers long, with a width of 14 - 18 meters. Walking on the city wall, you can overlook the beautiful scenery of Xuanwu Lake and Jiming Temple, and you can also see the unique combination of the ancient city wall and the modern high-rise building (Zifeng Building). The city bricks on the city wall are engraved with the names of the brick-making workshops and craftsmen, which is a precious material for studying the history of the Ming Dynasty's city construction.
Tips: 1. The city wall is made of stone and brick, and the surface is uneven in some places. Please wear non-slip shoes and take care when walking. 2. The wind on the city wall is relatively strong, especially in winter, so please bring a coat to keep warm. 3. Do not climb or lean on the edge of the city wall to avoid danger.

Title: Chaotian Palace (≥ØÃÏπ¨)
Description: Opening Hours: 9:00 - 17:00 (last entry at 16:30, closed on Mondays except public holidays). Average Cost: Approximately $8 (adult ticket), $4 (child ticket, 1.2-1.4 meters tall). Attraction Features: It is the most complete preserved ancient architectural complex of the Ming and Qing dynasties in the south of the Yangtze River, with a history of more than 2,500 years. The architectural layout of the palace is symmetrical along the central axis, including the Pan Pool, the Memorial Archway, the Lingxing Gate, the Dacheng Gate, the Dacheng Hall, and the Chongsheng Hall. The Dacheng Hall is the main hall of Chaotian Palace, with a height of 16 meters. It has a double-eaved gable and hip roof (a type of traditional Chinese roof) and is covered with golden glazed tiles, showing the grandeur of the ancient royal architecture. Now, Chaotian Palace is the location of the Nanjing Municipal Museum, which displays a large number of cultural relics reflecting the history and culture of Nanjing, such as the cultural relics of the Six Dynasties and the porcelain of the Ming and Qing dynasties.
Tips: 1. The Nanjing Municipal Museum in Chaotian Palace has a large number of cultural relics. It is recommended to rent an audio guide or join a guided tour to better understand the cultural connotation of the relics. 2. The architectural complex is large, so wear comfortable shoes and plan the visiting route in advance. 3. Do not take photos of the exhibits marked "No Photography" in the museum to protect the cultural relics.

Title: Nanjing Eye Footbridge (ƒœæ©—€≤Ω––«≈)
Description: Opening Hours: All day (outdoor bridge, no specific closing time; the lighting is on from 19:00 to 22:00 every night). Average Cost: Free. Attraction Features: It is a modern landmark bridge across the Yangtze River in Nanjing, and it is also the first pedestrian bridge across the Yangtze River in China. The bridge is 827 meters long, with two main towers in the shape of "eyes", so it is called "Nanjing Eye". The bridge is designed in a modern and elegant style, with a white main body and bright lights at night, making it look like a beautiful "harp" across the Yangtze River. Walking on the bridge, you can enjoy the beautiful scenery of the Yangtze River and the modern skyline of the Hexi New Town. It is a popular place for citizens and tourists to take a walk, exercise, and take photos at night.
Tips: 1. The bridge is a pedestrian bridge, so no vehicles are allowed to enter. Please walk in the specified area and do not run or play. 2. The wind on the bridge is relatively strong, especially in winter, so please keep warm. 3. The best time to visit is at night when the lights are on, but please pay attention to personal safety and do not stay on the bridge too late. 4. Do not climb over the guardrail of the bridge to avoid danger.
